detailsOfAchievement: The Guild For Service is a national voluntary developmental organization dedicated towards the empowerment of marginalized women and children. Working for more than four decades the Guild For Service has consultative status with the Economic and Social Council and the Department of Public Information of the United Nations. Through our various projects, women and children affected by conflict situations and other unfortunate circumstances are empowered economically, politically and socially by ensuring them their rights, providing shelter to the ones abused and shunned away from society, giving them vocational training to build their capacities and make them self reliant so that they are rehabilitated completely. The Guild For Service is sensitive to the need of marginalized women to feel secure in a safe environment. We have a home for the widows at Vrindavan, another for violence affected women and children at Srinagar, our centers are also at Savai Madhopur and Najafgarh. The Guild For Service combines both grass root work experience with a visionary perspective to advocate for meaningful change in society. Through the endeavors of the Guild For Service and the networking of other NGOs many changes have been brought about in India vis a vis new gender sensitive laws, effective enforcement, and a slow but definite moving away from age old stereotypes regarding the role and contribution of women towards nation building.

detailsOfAchievement: The spectrum of our activities:  Shelter Homes at Ma-Dham, Vrindavan  Kashmir Intervention, Raahat Ghar-Kashmir.  Vocational Training Programs at Sawai Madhopur Rajasthan and Najafgarh, Delhi.  Group Marriage Ceremony for under-privileged and marginalized.  Mahilla Panchayat and Mohalla Meetings  Gender Resource Centre.  Legal Literacy Camps.  Self help groups.  Family Counseling Centre in Delhi, Sawai Madhopur and Vrindavan.  Working Womens hostel  Campaign for Police Accountability.  Peace Initiatives The Five programmatic achievements of our organizations are as follows: I. Under the relm if Auxiliary Nurses training course we have got 90% placements including placements in private and government hospitals. They are successfully earning upto Rs. 20,000/- II. Intergrated home for the widows, which is a first of its kind. Under one roof the widows get the benefits of doctor facility, physiotherapy, green environment, food and shelter, leading towards a meaningful & healthy life. III. 1300 women belonging to the lower income strata in Delhi are organized into self help groups. The money is deposited in banks and achor during personal crisis as well as to start the new business. IV. Under the Empowerment of Widows Coalition-UN women project we have successfully created and trained 5 widow HRDs (Human Rights Defenders). They have further created 300 defenders in the five villages adopted by the Guild around Vrindavan. This has help to create a lot of awareness towards self help groups and problem solving. V. We have successfully settled the lives of 50,041 girls including widows remarriage, inter-caste, inter community, differently abled couples towards a change in the society since 44 years of its existence.

detailsOfAchievement: Gurgia Charities has constructed two class rooms in LBJP Inter College School Tilhar U.P. and has established a computer lab with appointment of two teachers. Gurgia Charities has established Physics, Chemistry and Biology laboratories in LBJP School. Gurgia Charities has constructed three lab rooms for setting up of physics,chemistry and biology labs in (girls school) LBDBRSHM College Tilhar and has established all three labs .

sourceOfFunds.purpose: In the year 2016-2017 Gurgia Charities received private donation from which blankets were distributed amongst the poor in District shahjahanpur U.P. Health awareness camp and medical camp was organised with the voluntary effort of the local and government Doctors. A camp for child protection was organised in Tilhar town. A sport awareness and training camp followed by a large based cricket tournament was organised in the LBJP Higher secondary school in Tilhar Town.

In the year 2018-2019, Gurgia Charities received grants from Sud Chemie for upgrading infrastructure and establishing a computer lab in LBJP Higher Secondary School. Two class rooms were reconstructed from the grants and a computer lab was established. Two computer teachers were also appointed. Other private Donation were received from which health awareness camp was organised and women empowerment program was also organised.

In the year 2018-2019, Gurgia Charities received grants from sud-chemie India pvt ltd for st up physics, chemistry and Biology labs IN LBJP Higher secondary School Tilhar U.P. Other private donations were recieved from which Yoga cum medical camp was organised in LBJP School. Clothes were distributed among poor children of Tilhar Town. Tehzeebe Tilhar was organised to promote communal harmony through Urdu and Hindi poetry.

In the year 2019-2020 , Gurgia Charities received grants from WAPCOS LIMITED FOR Constructing three rooms for setting up physics, chemistry, and biology labs in LALA BULAKI DAS BABU RAM SAHAI HINDU MAHILA COOLGE IN TILHAR U.P.
